eu_initiatives: Implementation of the European Guidelines for Dual Career in the European Union member countries
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Expert Group in charge of implementation of the EU Work Plan for Sport#E01564#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1564#Observer#C#Expert Group "Skills and human resources development in sport"
goals__remit: The European Athlete as Student (EAS) network has been founded in 2004 with the support of EU Commission during The European Year of Education Through Sport (EYES). It is for universities, sports schools and other educational establishments interested in high-performance sport as well as sports clubs and federations which are willing to help their athletes in their studies. The main aim of the EAS -network is to support European athletes in combining high-performance sport and education.
relevant_communication:
EMPATIA – Education Model for Parents of Athletes In Academics will run from January 2018 until December 2020. The focus is on information about the roles of parents and entourage of athletes during their dual careers and aims to offer online education tools in several languages for that specific supporting group of stakeholders (e.G. European Guidelines for Dual Career) 
AMId - Athletic migration: Dual Career and qualification in sports will run from January 2018 until October 2020.
